intro: Gonospermum ferulaceum, commonly known as the Australian burrhead, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its woody shrub form. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Its fruit is a dry, three-lobed capsule that disperses seeds through wind and animal activity. Gonospermum ferulaceum is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
